db:abstract.db:para: FrameGraph node to transfer a rectangle of pixel values from one region of a render target to another.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: This node inserts a glBlitFrameBuffer or an equivalent into the command stream. This provides a more efficient method for copying rectangles between textures or surface backbuffers wrapped by QRenderTarget than drawing textured quads. It also supports scaling with the specified interpolation method.

db:note.db:para: In practice the BlitFramebuffer node will often be used in combination with NoDraw since a blit should not involve issuing draw calls for any entities.

db:section.db:title: destination : RenderTarget
db:section.db:para: Specifies the destination render target. When not set, the destination is assumed to be the default framebuffer (i.e. the backbuffer of the current surface), if there is one.

db:note.db:para: the source and destination must not refer to the same render target.

db:section.db:title: destinationAttachmentPoint : RenderTargetOutput.AttachmentPoint
db:section.db:para: Specifies the source attachment point. Defaults to RenderTargetOutput.AttachmentPoint.Color0.

db:section.db:title: destinationRect : Rect
db:section.db:para: Specifies the destination rectangle. The coordinates are assumed to follow the normal Qt coordinate system, meaning Y runs from top to bottom.

db:section.db:title: interpolationMethod : InterpolationMethod
db:section.db:para: Specifies the interpolation applied if the image is stretched. Defaults to Linear.

db:section.db:title: source : RenderTarget
db:section.db:para: Specifies the source render target. When not set, the source is assumed to be the default framebuffer (i.e. the backbuffer of the current surface), if there is one.

db:note.db:para: the source and destination must not refer to the same render target.

db:section.db:title: sourceAttachmentPoint : RenderTargetOutput.AttachmentPoint
db:section.db:para: Specifies the source attachment point. Defaults to RenderTargetOutput.AttachmentPoint.Color0.

db:section.db:title: sourceRect : Rect
db:section.db:para: Specifies the source rectangle. The coordinates are assumed to follow the normal Qt coordinate system, meaning Y runs from top to bottom.
